choices.C: CDP is supported on Frame Relay sub interfaces.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about CDP are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The Cisco Discovery Protocol does not possess inherent security mechanisms and is vulnerable to attacks. The Secure Cisco Discovery Protocol feature allows users to select the type, length, value (TLV) fields that are sent on a particular interface to filter information sent through Cisco Discovery Protocol packets.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/cdp/configuration/15-mt/cdp-15-mt-book/nm-cdp-secure-cdp.html

CDP is supported of FR interface and subinterfaces, but not by default:
=================================
Hub#sh run int s1/0.901
!
interface Serial1/0.901 point-to-point
 ip address 10.0.91.9 255.255.255.0
 frame-relay interface-dlci 901 
end

Hub#sh run int s1/0.902

!
interface Serial1/0.902 point-to-point
 ip address 10.0.92.9 255.255.255.0
 frame-relay interface-dlci 902 
end
!
Hub#sh cdp neighbors | b Device
Device ID Local Intrfce Holdtme Capability Platform Port ID
Spoke2 Ser 1/0.902 14 R 7206VXR Ser 1/0
Spoke1 Ser 1/0.901 15 R 7206VXR Ser 1/0
==============================

questions.question_text: Which two statements about SPAN source and destination ports during an active session are true? (Choose two.)

choices.E: You can mix individual source ports and source VLANs within a single session.
choices.D: The destination port does not participate in STP.
choices.B: The source port can be monitored in multiple SPAN sessions.
choices.C: The destination port can be destination in multiple SPAN sessions.
choices.A: The source port can be only an Ethernet physical port.

discussion.content:
Yes, B D

"The switch supports any number of source ports (up to the maximum number of available ports on the switch) and any number of source VLANs (up to the maximum number of VLANs supported). However, the switch supports a maximum of two sessions (local or RSPAN) with source ports or VLANs, and you cannot mix ports and VLANs in a single session.

A source port has these characteristics:
It can be monitored in multiple SPAN sessions.
It can be any port type (for example, EtherChannel, Fast Ethernet, Gigabit Ethernet, and so forth).
For EtherChannel sources, you can monitor traffic for the entire EtherChannel or individually on a physical port as it participates in the port channel.

A destination port has these characteristics:
It can participate in only one SPAN session at a time (a destination port in one SPAN session cannot be a destination port for a second SPAN session).
It does not participate in any of the Layer 2 protocols (STP, VTP, CDP, DTP, PagP)."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst2960/software/release/12-2_55_se/configuration/guide/scg_2960/swspan.html

C. If Fa0/0 is shut down, the HSRP priority on R2 becomes 80 
Misspelling? Should it be F1/0?

comments.content: No, it's correct. See "Track interface Fa0/0..."

questions.question_text: In a switch stack environment, what is the total bidirectional traffic flow between two logical counter-rotating paths?

choices.C: The LLDP reinitialisation delay is 5 seconds.
choices.B: The LLDP global state is Disabled.
choices.A: The LLDP hold time is 60 seconds.
choices.D: The LLDP interface state is Enabled.

discussion.content:
Parameter Default
Global LLDP Disabled
LLDP on interfaces Enabled, after LLDP is enabled globally
LLDP hold time (before discarding) 120 seconds
LLDP reinitialization delay 2 seconds
LLDP timer (packet update frequency) 30 seconds
LLDP TLVs Enabled
LLDP receive Enabled, after LLDP is enabled globally
LLDP transmit Enabled, after LLDP is enabled globally
DCBXP Enabled, provided LLDP is enabled
